note: 'State-based' conflicts are between states, or a state and a non-state armed organised group. The 'best' estimates from the sources are used, or - if unavailable - the mid-point between high and low estimates.
title: Deaths in state-based conflicts by world region
subtitle: Direct deaths of both military personnel and civilians. Deaths from disease or famine are not included. The region does not always relate to where the fighting occurred â€“ it sometimes refers to the region of the participants in the conflict.

relatedQuestions.text: Counting world conflict deaths: why do sources differ?
